summary: Expanded the backend modular monolith stub into an M1 scaffold spec with module boundaries, cross-module interfaces, tick orchestration, bootstrap implementation steps, and documented assumptions/deferred decisions.

Bootstrapped the framework-agnostic backend modular monolith source tree under backend/src with app/shared/module boundaries and placeholder layer files for all planned M1 modules, plus a scaffold note mapping the layout to the architecture spec.

proposed_work_items.title: Define backend shared primitives and module bootstrap interfaces
proposed_work_items.description: Add framework-agnostic starter code stubs in backend/src/shared and backend/src/app for core primitives (IDs, result/error type, clock abstraction, in-process event bus interface) plus a module registration/composition contract so module implementations can be added without breaking boundaries.
acceptance_criteria: backend/src/shared contains initial typed placeholder modules/files for IDs, result/error, and time abstraction responsibilities
backend/src/app contains a framework-agnostic composition/bootstrap contract that references modules through interfaces rather than concrete infra adapters
Module scaffold notes remain consistent with the new shared/app stubs and no framework-specific runtime dependency is introduced

summary: Added framework-agnostic typed shared primitives (IDs, result/error, clock, in-process event bus) and app composition/bootstrap contracts for module registration via interfaces, plus scaffold note updates.

proposed_work_items.title: Add reference in-memory service registry and event bus for bootstrap smoke tests
proposed_work_items.description: Implement minimal in-memory adapters for the new `ServiceRegistry` and `InProcessEventBus` contracts plus a bootstrap smoke composition example to validate module registration flow before framework selection.
acceptance_criteria: Reference implementations depend only on backend shared/app contracts and no framework runtime
A simple bootstrap smoke path can compose at least one placeholder module using the contracts
Any notes/docs added describe the adapters as temporary reference implementations

summary: Serialized the v1 starter markdown economy/buildings/units tables into machine-readable backend JSON seed configs, including civ activation/modifiers, unit variants, variant modifiers, and an explicit first-slice enablement filter limited to cinder_throne_legates.

proposed_work_items.title: Add typed seed loaders and validation for v1 starter config JSON
proposed_work_items.description: Implement framework-agnostic loader utilities and schema/shape validation for the new v1 JSON seed files so modules can consume starter config safely and enforce stable IDs plus first-slice filtering at startup.
acceptance_criteria: Backend includes typed loader functions for economy/buildings/units starter seed JSON files and civilization config files
Validation rejects malformed rows, duplicate IDs, and missing cross-references (e.g. producer_building_id, base_unit_id) with clear errors
A first-slice filtering helper applies the enablement config and excludes balance/data stubs by default

summary: Added temporary framework-agnostic reference adapters for in-memory service registry and event bus, a reference bootstrap composer, and a smoke helper that composes a placeholder module and validates service/event wiring.

proposed_work_items.title: Add automated contract smoke tests for reference bootstrap adapters
proposed_work_items.description: Add lightweight tests around the temporary reference `ServiceRegistry`, `InProcessEventBus`, and bootstrap composer to lock expected contract behavior (duplicate registration failure, subscribe/unsubscribe delivery, lifecycle hook collection) while the production runtime stack is still deferred.
acceptance_criteria: Tests cover successful placeholder module composition through `ReferenceApplicationBootstrap` with lifecycle hook collection
Tests verify `InMemoryEventBus` publish/subscribe and unsubscribe behavior for a single event type
Tests verify `InMemoryServiceRegistry` resolve/tryResolve behavior and duplicate registration failure

summary: Added framework-agnostic typed v1 starter seed loaders/parsers with shape validation, duplicate ID/row checks, cross-reference validation across economy/buildings/units/civilization seeds, and a first-slice enablement filtering helper with default stub hiding.

proposed_work_items.title: Add backend tests for v1 starter seed loader validation and first-slice filtering
proposed_work_items.description: Add focused tests for the new v1 seed loader utilities covering malformed shape errors, duplicate IDs/rows, missing cross-references, and first-slice filtering behavior using the committed seed JSON fixtures.
acceptance_criteria: Tests cover at least one malformed object shape failure with clear error message assertion
Tests cover duplicate keyed IDs or duplicate row identity rejection
Tests cover missing cross-reference rejection (e.g. producer_building_id or base_unit_id)
Tests verify first-slice filtering excludes balance/data stubs and keeps cinder_throne_legates starter content by default

summary: Defined a machine-readable V1 narrative placeholder seed format (JSON tables + JSON schema) for civilization intros, starter settlement name pools, and event feed messages with stable keys, slice scope flags, related selectors, and explicit token lists.

proposed_work_items.title: Add typed backend loaders and validation helpers for v1 narrative seed tables
proposed_work_items.description: Implement framework-agnostic loader/parser utilities for the new narrative JSON tables and enforce the shared narrative row shape (required fields, unique keys per table, token list consistency with template placeholders) at startup or in tests.
acceptance_criteria: Backend exposes typed loaders/parsers for `civilization-intros.json`, `starter-settlement-name-pool.json`, and `event-feed-messages.json`
Validation rejects missing required narrative fields (`key`, `slice_status_scope`, `categories`, `related_ids`, `template`, `tokens`) and duplicate row keys within a table
Validation checks template token placeholders match the declared `tokens` array order/uniqueness
No gameplay mechanics are added; work remains data loading/validation only

summary: Added focused backend tests for v1 starter seed loaders covering malformed shapes, duplicate row identities, missing cross-references, and default first-slice filtering behavior against committed seed fixtures.

Added framework-agnostic v1 narrative seed loaders/parsers with typed row/table contracts and strict validation for required row fields, unique keys, and template/token consistency; included fixture-backed tests and exported the new loader module.

Implemented a deterministic first-slice settlement resource tick/projection service for food/wood/stone/iron with bounded starter-content defaults, per-resource reason codes, and placeholder event payloads for client state/event-feed binding.

proposed_work_items.title: Integrate settlement resource projection service with backend tick runner composition
proposed_work_items.description: Wire the new deterministic economy projection service into the app-level module tick orchestration path so resource projection output can be applied/saved and published through the in-process event bus during scheduled simulation ticks.
acceptance_criteria: App composition can resolve an economy tick service instance and invoke it for one settlement tick cycle
Projected placeholder economy tick events are published via the existing in-memory event bus contract
Integration remains first-slice bounded to a single settlement and starter resources only

summary: Implemented first-slice building upgrade and unit training command handlers using starter-table defaults/filtering, with structured accepted/failed outcomes (`insufficient_resources`, `cooldown`, `invalid_state`) and placeholder success event keys for feed wiring.

proposed_work_items.title: Wire first-slice upgrade/train handlers into backend command transport and settlement persistence ports
proposed_work_items.description: Integrate the new first-slice building upgrade and unit training handlers with module API command entrypoints and persistence-facing ports so accepted commands can reserve resources, persist queue state, and publish placeholder events through app composition.
acceptance_criteria: A backend command entrypoint can invoke the building upgrade handler for `grain_plot` and return the structured accepted/failed result payload unchanged
A backend command entrypoint can invoke the unit train handler for `watch_levy` and return the structured accepted/failed result payload unchanged
Accepted results can be persisted through explicit settlement/building/unit queue port interfaces (in-memory reference adapters are acceptable for first integration pass)
Accepted command placeholder events (`event.buildings.upgrade_started`, `event.units.training_started`) are published through the in-process event bus contract

summary: Applied approved Pass A starter tuning values to serialized v1 economy/building seeds (starting stock, passive income, producer cost multipliers, and barracks/rally food+wood costs) and revalidated seed loader tests.

proposed_work_items.title: Re-run early progression sim against serialized Pass A seeds and evaluate rally micro-pass
proposed_work_items.description: Run the first 2-6h pacing simulation using the updated serialized seed bundle to confirm barracks timing target (<2h) and determine whether a narrow rally_post/stone cost micro-pass is still required without adding mechanics.
acceptance_criteria: Simulation run consumes current serialized backend seed bundle values
Output reports barracks L1 completion timing and rally_post L1 reachability by 6h against documented targets
If rally_post remains outside target, proposed deltas are limited to narrow numeric cost changes and captured as a separate backlog item

summary: Added v1 seed/config and runtime support for `buildings.building_activation_thresholds`, including table parsing/validation, first-slice filtering, and deterministic threshold evaluation (`resource_stock_ratio`, `resource_stock_ratio_any`, `building_level_min` with AND semantics per `building_id + threshold_phase`).

proposed_work_items.title: Wire building activation threshold evaluation into settlement building visibility/read-model flow
proposed_work_items.description: Integrate the new deterministic threshold evaluator into the buildings query/state projection path so reveal/unlock state for post-slice buildings can be computed from settlement stock/cap/level snapshots and surfaced through backend DTOs.
acceptance_criteria: A buildings read/query path can return reveal/unlock state for `granary`, `warehouse`, `palisade`, `watchtower`, and `guardhouse` using `building_activation_thresholds` rows
Rows for the same `building_id` + `threshold_phase` are evaluated with AND semantics through the integrated path
First-slice output remains unchanged when activation threshold rows are filtered out by first-slice enablement

summary: Implemented `world_map.scout_select_v1` endpoint contract wiring for `POST /world-map/tiles/{tileId}/interact` with a deterministic first-slice scout-select service, strict M0 request gating (`scout` + `v1`), and response DTOs constrained to the three contract outcomes and stable tile states.

Integrated the deterministic settlement resource projection service into a first-slice app-level economy tick module. The module resolves/owns the projection service, runs scheduled settlement tick cycles through lifecycle hooks, persists updated stock state in a first-slice in-memory service, and publishes placeholder projection events via the in-process event bus.

proposed_work_items.title: Persist first-slice economy tick state in a repository-backed adapter
proposed_work_items.description: Replace the in-memory first-slice settlement tick state holder in the economy tick module with a persistence adapter so ticked resource projections are durable and shared across module boundaries.
acceptance_criteria: A concrete economy tick state repository persists `tick_started_at`, `tick_ended_at`, and per-resource stock after each tick.
App-level tick state can be read back through an injectable token/service after a scheduled cycle.
Economy tick placeholder event emission remains unchanged by the persistence migration.

summary: Re-ran serialized early-progression simulation with current Pass A v1 seeds and confirmed barracks and watch_levy cadence targets pass while rally_post remains outside 6h.

checkpoints.building_state: grain_plot L2, timber_camp L2, stone_quarry L1, iron_pit L1
grain_plot L2, timber_camp L2, stone_quarry L1, iron_pit L1, barracks L1
grain_plot L2, timber_camp L2, stone_quarry L1, iron_pit L1, barracks L1

proposed_work_items.title: Apply narrow rally_post cost-only micro-pass and rerun KPIs
proposed_work_items.description: Apply only rally_post L1 cost reductions to reach rally_post by 6h without introducing new mechanics, then re-run RK-M1-0006-F02-F01-F01-F01 acceptance checks.
acceptance_criteria: Only rally_post L1 costs are changed in `backend/src/modules/buildings/infra/seeds/v1/building-lines.json`
Proposed values: cost_food_l1 70->55, cost_wood_l1 70->33, cost_stone_l1 remains at 52-equivalent target band
Re-run 30m/2h/6h checkpoints and confirm `rally_post` reaches L1 by 6h
No additional mechanics, multipliers, or non-rally building values are changed

summary: Added deterministic settlement building activation read-model projection service and tests to evaluate reveal/unlock states for post-slice buildings from threshold rows, enforce AND semantics per building/phase, and preserve first-slice defaults when activation rows are filtered.

Added placeholder world-map scout seed fixtures for deterministic M0 tile outcomes, including one tile each in unknown/quiet/hostile states and explicit scout event token fixtures for `target_tile_label` and `hostile_force_estimate`.

proposed_work_items.title: Wire world-map scout seed fixtures into dev bootstrap/dev fixture loader
proposed_work_items.description: Add a lightweight fixture loader that hydrates the world-map tile state repository with rows from `world-map-tile-seed-fixtures.json` so local/dev runs can replay all three scout outcomes with deterministic fixture tile ids.
acceptance_criteria: Backend can load the new world-map tile seed file and return world-map tile snapshots keyed by settlement_id+tile_id.
A single dev flow can execute all three scout outcomes using seeded tile ids.
Fixture hostile rows include `hostile_force_estimate` and quiet rows include `target_tile_label` so events render placeholder tokens deterministically.

summary: Migrated first-slice economy tick state persistence from module-local mutable object storage to a repository-backed adapter and kept event placeholder emission behavior unchanged.

proposed_work_items.title: Add durable storage-backed settlement tick repository implementation
proposed_work_items.description: Replace or supplement the in-memory first-slice settlement tick state repository with a persistence-backed implementation (file/db) so ticked stocks survive process restarts and can be shared across process boundaries.
acceptance_criteria: Tick state reads and writes are persisted to a durable store and can be loaded after restart.
Existing module registration and token contracts remain unchanged.
Current in-memory implementation remains available for reference tests.

summary: Applied micro-pass rally_post-only L1 cost deltas and re-ran the 30m/2h/6h reference simulation; barracks/training targets pass but rally_post still misses the 6h acceptance target.
blockers: Rally_post still does not reach L1 by 6h with only the applied cost delta (`cost_food_l1 64->55`, `cost_wood_l1 64->33`, `cost_stone_l1 52->52`).

checkpoint_updates.building_state: grain_plot L2, timber_camp L2, stone_quarry L1, iron_pit L1
grain_plot L2, timber_camp L2, stone_quarry L1, iron_pit L1, barracks L1
grain_plot L2, timber_camp L2, stone_quarry L1, iron_pit L1, barracks L1

proposed_work_items.title: Run a second rally/stone-only micro-sweep and finalize 6h pass
proposed_work_items.description: Sweep narrow rally_post L1 cost candidates that preserve the same mechanics-only constraint and choose the smallest delta that guarantees rally_post reaches L1 by 6h on the same reference policy in `docs/design/v1-early-progression-pacing-sim.md`.
acceptance_criteria: Only `rally_post` L1 fields in `backend/src/modules/buildings/infra/seeds/v1/building-lines.json` are modified.
Post-sweep 30m/2h/6h checkpoints are refreshed and committed in the design doc.
Rally_post L1 reaches by <=6h while barracks/training timings remain at or above prior pass quality.
validation_commands: Re-run RK-M1-0006-F02-F01-F02 replay assumptions and table capture against current serialized starter seed bundle

summary: Re-ran serialized replay checkpoints after applying narrowed rally_post-only cost-only tuning (55/33/52). Barracks timing and early training targets now pass, but rally_post does not complete by 6h.
blockers: Rally-post L1 still completes after 6h with the narrowed pass (`rally_post` starts at 5h 59m 57s and reaches L1 at 6h 2m 27s).

checkpoint_updates.building_state: grain_plot L2, timber_camp L2, stone_quarry L1, iron_pit L1
grain_plot L2, timber_camp L2, stone_quarry L1, iron_pit L1, barracks L1

proposed_work_items.title: Add deterministic rally_post timing sweep harness and test harness for RK-M1 pacing checkpoints
proposed_work_items.description: Create an internal deterministic replay utility used by backend simulation checks to produce 30m/2h/6h checkpoints from serialized v1 seed fixtures, including rally_post timing output.
acceptance_criteria: Utility can run the same reference policy against serialized v1 seeds and emit checkpoints as machine-readable JSON and markdown-friendly tables
Utility confirms current blockers (`rally_post` not complete by 6h with rally_post costs set to 55/33/52)
Outputs are stable under repeated runs and can be pasted into docs/design/v1-early-progression-pacing-sim.md

summary: Wired world-map scout fixture loader/parsers and added a repository hydration test path to replay all three deterministic scout outcomes from seed fixtures.
Added a deterministic RK-M0-0014 progression profile generator command, wrapper script, and runbook pointer so reseed refreshes no longer depend on lane-specific automation instructions.

proposed_work_items.title: Generate RK-M0-0014 profile directly from backend seed replay
proposed_work_items.description: Replace fixture-as-seed copy behavior with deterministic replay from first-slice backend seed fixtures when that pipeline is introduced, so profile regeneration remains tied to source seed tables and policy logic.
acceptance_criteria: Generator output is produced from serialized seed fixtures or replay pipeline output instead of a static fixture copy.
Generator command and path remain unchanged for callers (`python tools/rk_m0_0014_progression_profile.py`).
Rerunning generation with unchanged seeds produces byte-for-byte identical output.

summary: Added node:test contract smoke coverage for reference bootstrap adapters, including lifecycle hook collection, in-memory event bus subscribe/unsubscribe delivery, and in-memory service registry resolve/tryResolve/duplicate registration behavior.

Added a durable file-backed settlement tick repository implementation for first-slice economy ticks, wired the economy tick runner module to use it by default with configurable storage path, and kept the in-memory repository in place for reference/tests.
Updated RK-M0-0014 profile generation to resolve replay/serialized seed source before fixture fallback while keeping generator command and output path stable.

results.determinism: Byte-stable output for unchanged source payload via deterministic JSON serialization path.

proposed_work_items.title: Wire RK-M0-0014 generator to true backend seed replay pipeline output
proposed_work_items.description: Replace the current replay fallback contract with the actual backend replay payload contract/output artifact once backend seed replay pipeline is available.
acceptance_criteria: Generator reads from a backend-produced RK-M0-0014 progression replay artifact path without wrapper/user-specified seed path.
Replay artifacts include deterministic settlement and scout snapshots that match backend policy logic outputs.
Smoke profile still regenerates via the same command invocation and remains byte-for-byte deterministic for unchanged replay payloads.

summary: Wired RK-M0-0014 progression profile generation to consume backend replay artifacts directly (no wrapper payload probing, no legacy fixture fallback), preserving the same CLI and deterministic output behavior.

proposed_work_items.title: Validate backend replay payload schema against RK-M0-0014 contract
proposed_work_items.description: Add a focused smoke check that loads one backend-produced RK-M0-0014 replay artifact and asserts it contains required snapshot arrays, before this generator is used in CI-like refresh scripts.
acceptance_criteria: Replay artifact for one known path can be validated without additional wrapper/key-shape translation.
Validation rejects missing `settlement_snapshots` and `event_scout_snapshots` with a clear error.
No changes are required to smoke assertions beyond existing profile load behavior.

summary: Validated backend replay artifact wiring end-to-end: generator consumed replay payload path directly, regenerated deterministic output via unchanged command, and smoke checkpoints passed.

Locked RK-M0-0014 profile generation to the backend replay pipeline artifact path (no user-provided source path), kept the same command invocation, and revalidated deterministic output and smoke behavior.

Added a deferred M2 backend plan doc defining hero runtime state schema, assignment linkage, shared modifier-pipeline integration hooks for combat/scout resolution, and stable event keys for assignment/activation/cooldown completion.

proposed_work_items.title: Implement hero runtime persistence contracts and repositories
proposed_work_items.description: Create schema migrations and repository interfaces/implementations for hero runtime states, assignment bindings, and hero modifier runtime instances exactly as defined in the M2 backend hero runtime schema plan.
acceptance_criteria: Runtime persistence includes `heroes.hero_runtime_states_v1`, `heroes.hero_assignment_bindings_v1`, and `heroes.hero_modifier_instances_v1` tables with documented uniqueness/consistency constraints.
Repository contracts support atomic assignment updates and ability activation writes with optimistic concurrency.
No hero-specific combat/scout formulas are introduced in persistence layer.

proposed_work_items.title: Wire hero modifier instances into shared action modifier aggregation
proposed_work_items.description: Extend the shared numeric modifier aggregation path used by action resolution so combat/scout calculators consume hero ability effects from runtime modifier instances by domain/trigger window/context.
acceptance_criteria: Action resolution reads hero modifier runtime instances through the same numeric aggregation interface as other modifier sources.
Combat and scout resolvers consume resolved numeric stats without hero-id branches.
Charge and expiry consumption for hero modifier instances executes in the shared post-resolution modifier lifecycle path.

proposed_work_items.title: Define and validate hero runtime event token fixtures
proposed_work_items.description: Add machine-readable event token fixtures and validation for `event.hero.assigned`, `event.hero.ability_activated`, and `event.hero.cooldown_complete` so client event feed rendering can rely on stable keys and required token sets.
acceptance_criteria: A hero runtime event-token table defines required tokens for assignment, activation, and cooldown completion event keys.
Loader/validator rejects mismatched key-to-token mappings and duplicate identities.
Contract tests assert emitted hero runtime events conform to the declared key/token fixtures.

summary: Implemented M2 hero runtime persistence contracts with in-memory/file-backed repository adapters and SQL migrations for runtime states, assignment bindings, and runtime modifier instances, including optimistic concurrency writes for assignment and ability activation.

proposed_work_items.title: Add hero runtime migration execution tests against the selected DB runtime
proposed_work_items.description: Add migration-runner validation that applies the hero runtime migration and proves uniqueness/consistency constraints for runtime rows, assignment bindings, and modifier instances in a real database environment.
acceptance_criteria: Automated test setup can apply `20260226_000001_create_hero_runtime_tables_v1.sql` end-to-end.
Tests verify active assignment uniqueness constraints and readiness/cooldown consistency checks fail invalid writes.
Tests verify rollback/reset path leaves the schema clean for repeatable CI runs.

proposed_work_items.title: Wire assignment context ownership validation to context-owning repositories
proposed_work_items.description: Integrate hero assignment writes with owning module read ports (army/scout/siege) so assignment context ownership by `player_id` is validated transactionally before binding activation.
acceptance_criteria: Assignment mutation rejects contexts not owned by the requesting player.
Validation runs inside the same write boundary as assignment/runtime updates.
Contract tests cover allowed and rejected ownership cases for all supported context types.

summary: Implemented shared action modifier aggregation wiring for hero runtime instances across combat/scout resolution, including shared post-resolution lifecycle consumption for modifier charge and expiry updates.

results.validation_note: Sandbox denied Node test worker spawn (`spawn EPERM`), so automated TS test execution could not be completed in this run.

proposed_work_items.title: Thread scout action context through API endpoint for modifier-backed resolution
proposed_work_items.description: Propagate player and assignment context identity from world-map interaction endpoint inputs (or derived auth/session context) into scout action resolution so hero runtime modifiers can apply on the HTTP execution path without manual service-level inputs.
acceptance_criteria: Scout endpoint execution path passes `player_id`, `assignment_context_type`, and `assignment_context_id` into `DeterministicWorldMapScoutSelectService` action-resolution input.
When a matching active hero runtime scout modifier exists for `next_scout_action`, scout output reflects resolved numeric stats and shared lifecycle consumption updates modifier status/charges.
Endpoint contract tests cover both baseline behavior and modifier-backed behavior.

summary: Added a Postgres-backed hero runtime migration runner plus integration-style migration execution tests that apply `20260226_000001_create_hero_runtime_tables_v1.sql`, validate runtime/assignment/modifier constraints, and verify reset/re-apply repeatability.

results.validation_note: Sandbox denied Node test worker spawn (`spawn EPERM`) for `node --test`, but TypeScript syntax checks passed for the new migration runner and test files.

summary: Wired assignment context ownership validation into hero assignment writes via injected army/scout/siege ownership read repositories, added an explicit ownership conflict path, and covered allowed/rejected ownership contract cases for all supported context types.

results.validation_note: TypeScript syntax checks passed. Node test runner execution remained blocked in this sandbox (`spawn EPERM`).

summary: Added hero runtime event token fixtures, strict loader validation for key-to-token mappings and duplicate identities, and contract tests that validate emitted assignment/activation/cooldown hero events against the declared fixture table.

results.validation_note: TypeScript syntax checks passed. Node test runner execution remained blocked in this sandbox (`spawn EPERM`).

summary: Threaded scout player/context identity through the world-map tile interact endpoint into scout action resolution and added endpoint contract coverage for modifier-backed hostile report resolution with lifecycle consumption.

results.validation_note: TypeScript syntax checks passed for touched files. Full endpoint contract test execution was not available in this sandbox because plain Node ESM test execution cannot resolve the repository's directory imports without the project TypeScript runner.

summary: Exposed first-slice settlement loop contract adapters for settlement tick, building upgrade, unit train, and scout interaction; added deterministic request/response DTO handlers with stable placeholder event/state payloads and consistent failure error-code mapping for insufficient_resources, cooldown, and unavailable_tile.

proposed_work_items.title: Wire first-slice settlement loop contract adapters into a concrete backend transport
proposed_work_items.description: Bind the new tick/upgrade/train/scout endpoint handlers to the chosen runtime transport (HTTP or local RPC) and expose route wiring so client integration can call the backend contract shapes directly instead of local stub adapters.
acceptance_criteria: Transport wiring exposes routes for settlement tick, building upgrade, unit train, and world-map scout interaction using the new endpoint handlers.
Error-code responses for insufficient_resources, cooldown, and unavailable_tile propagate through transport without key renames.
A smoke path demonstrates client-facing invocation against at least one wired runtime route.

summary: Wired first-slice settlement loop endpoint handlers into a concrete local-RPC backend transport, exposed route registration/invocation for tick/build/train/scout contracts, and added transport-level smoke/contract tests that preserve insufficient_resources, cooldown, and unavailable_tile error-code payload keys.

results.validation_note: TypeScript strip-types checks passed for all touched backend transport files. Node test execution still fails in this environment due repository-wide ESM TypeScript directory/extensionless imports (`ERR_UNSUPPORTED_DIR_IMPORT`, `ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND`). Orchestrator status command passed.

proposed_work_items.title: Replace client web local loop stubs with backend transport invocation bridge
proposed_work_items.description: Connect `client-web` settlement action adapter calls to the new backend first-slice transport route invocations (direct bridge/dev shim) so tick/build/train/scout actions no longer rely on duplicated local simulation logic.
acceptance_criteria: Client settlement tick/build/train action calls invoke the backend transport routes and consume returned contract payloads directly.
Client world-map scout interaction path invokes backend transport route and handles unavailable_tile failure via existing event key flow.
Client-side action adapter no longer duplicates first-slice economic/build/train/scout simulation rules that now exist in backend handlers.

summary: Added deterministic server-authoritative world-map march snapshot contracts/services with near-realtime interval emission, interpolation-ready movement payloads, deterministic arrival/combat resolution, and local transport route wiring for client polling.

results.validation_note: TypeScript strip-types checks passed for touched files. Node test runner execution is still blocked by repository-wide ESM directory imports (`ERR_UNSUPPORTED_DIR_IMPORT`) in this environment.

summary: Added deterministic world-map seasonal lifecycle modeling and scheduler orchestration for open/lock/archive/reset transitions, including season archive snapshots, rollover reset of joinable runtime state, and stable lifecycle placeholder event keys for UI/ops visibility.

results.validation_note: TypeScript strip-types checks passed for touched files. Node test runner execution for the new test remains blocked in this environment by repository-wide ESM directory imports (`ERR_UNSUPPORTED_DIR_IMPORT`).

proposed_work_items.title: Wire world lifecycle scheduler into backend runtime hook and transport surface
proposed_work_items.description: Integrate the new world lifecycle scheduler with an app lifecycle hook or transport route so operators/UI can advance world lifecycle ticks and consume emitted lifecycle events/archive summaries without direct module invocation.
acceptance_criteria: A backend runtime path invokes the lifecycle scheduler for a target world using deterministic observed-at timestamps.
Lifecycle transition events and latest archive summary are exposed through a stable contract response for UI/ops use.
No additional post-slice mechanics are introduced beyond open/lock/archive/reset scheduling and rollover state reset.

summary: Added deterministic neutral-node spawning and ambush-enabled gathering loop contracts/services with in-memory persistence, plus narrative event-feed keys for gather start/complete and ambush triggered/resolved outcomes.

results.validation_note: TypeScript strip-types checks passed for touched files. Node test execution remains blocked in this environment by repository TypeScript ESM import resolution constraints (`ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND`, `ERR_UNSUPPORTED_DIR_IMPORT`).

proposed_work_items.title: Expose neutral gathering and ambush resolution through backend transport route
proposed_work_items.description: Wire `DeterministicWorldMapNeutralGatheringService` into a transport-facing world-map route so clients can dispatch gather marches and poll deterministic resolution payloads/events without direct module invocation.
acceptance_criteria: Transport exposes a stable gather command contract that starts gather marches against seeded neutral nodes.
Transport exposes a deterministic gather resolution/poll contract returning gather and ambush event payloads.
Failures for unknown/depleted nodes and duplicate march IDs return stable error codes.

proposed_work_items.title: Apply resolved gather haul outputs to settlement resource projection
proposed_work_items.description: Integrate resolved `gathered_yield` outputs with economy resource ledgers so successful gather marches materialize into settlement stock changes and intercepted marches respect reduced haul totals.
acceptance_criteria: Gather resolution writes resource deltas into the same settlement stock model used by tick/build/train flows.
Ambush-intercepted outcomes apply deterministic reduced or zeroed haul based on service config.
Event payloads and resulting resource ledger deltas remain deterministic for identical seeds and inputs.

proposed_work_items.title: Enforce hostile attack march cap and deterministic impassable-path validation
proposed_work_items.description: Extend the hostile settlement attack command flow to enforce `max_active_marches` and reject blocked paths per deterministic world-map v1 phasing rules (`path_blocked_impassable`, `max_active_marches_reached`).
acceptance_criteria: Attack dispatch rejects when active march count exceeds configured cap with `error_code=max_active_marches_reached`.
Attack dispatch rejects when deterministic route crosses impassable tiles with `error_code=path_blocked_impassable`.
Deterministic acceptance/failure outcomes are covered by backend tests and exposed through transport contract responses.
